page.title: 12Niton Radio Station
page.content: It is part of{British Telecom.}The job involves speaking to the smallest of yachts through to oil drilling platforms, passenger liners and sometimes aircraft. The most important part of the service is{to listen for {ships in distress}and to pass the details on to the Coastguard. Information is received from ships about Navigational Buoys missing or unlit.This is passed on to Trinity House at East Cowes. A lot of messages are still passed using{morse code}but most of the work now is the connecting of telephone calls between ships at sea and ordinary telephone subscribers ashore.Navigational & Gale Warnings and Weather Forecasts are broadcast using ordinary speech, morse code and the latest method called{Navtex,}which prints the message text automatically on a special machine on board ship.
